name: The Sherwood Taipei

reviews.text: this is a typical business hotel. the renovation has been completed and so i did not encounter disturbance from it. The swimming pool is extremely small although the gym is fully equipped. A pity that there are not many eating places near the hotel.
reviews.title: typical business hotel

reviews.text: The service at the Sherwood is second to none. The rooms have been recently updated and are elegant and well appointed but not as flashy as other hotels I have stayed in Asia. The overall feeling of this hotel is more European than Asian. Despite its ammenities, the size is not overwhelming.
reviews.title: The Sherwood's Cozy Elegance makes this my favorite Asian Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel with my friends last weekend and I did have a top-notch experience at this hotel!!!
reviews.title: Execellent Service! Great Boutique Hotel at Taipei City

reviews.text: 1. The location is great. There are several bus stations right in front of the hotel and only 5 mins walk to the MRT station.
reviews.title: Not a good choice for a 5 star hotel in Taipei

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The service was great! while we approaching the lobby, there was a very nice gentleman helped us with the luggages and bring us to the check-in counter. Also, I experienced the most efficient ckeck-in ever! The staffs are professional, fast, and warm.
reviews.title: Bad experience
Bad Service, not good for family vacation
reviews.text: 3. Hotel rooms are spacious and quiet. The rooms I think were newly renovated with very very comfortable bed. My friend asked for a different type of pillow and then the room service staff gave us 5 different types!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the sort of hotel that 15 years ago would have received a top rating, unfortunately, notwithstanding the absolutly excellent staff, the facilities and decor are very dated - especially considering the price for the rooms.
reviews.title: Faded Grandeur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are reasonably well appointed (we just stayed in a standard deluxe) and the walls were solid enough so that one is undisturbed by adjacent guests. However, the decor is very tired (when was beige last in vogue?) and the pillows and matresses had obviously seen plenty of service and were obviously near the end of their serviceable life. One small comment is that given the lack of "plumpness" of they pillows then it would be good to have 4 per king size bed without having to have to ask for extra.
reviews.title: What you would expect from a Luxury Elegant Business Hotel
Great place to stay
reviews.text: As for the rest of the hotel facilities, the choice of restaurants is excellent and the quality within these very good indeed if a little pricey. On the subject of price I would say that overall this hotel no longer represents value for money when considering that for a similar amount one could stay in a more modern (and more central) 5-star hotel.

I will however compliment the staff who were positive, helpful, co-operative and understanding throughout and even arranged a complimentary birthday cake for my wife without my having to ask. Without them our stay would not have been so good.
reviews.title: Elegant and Refined

reviews.text: We stayed at Sherwood Taipei during our 5 days shortbreak at Taipei. We chose Sherwood Taipei due to its location being near to the train station and shopping areas.
reviews.title: very comfortable business hotel

description: In 1990, when we first started offering world-class hospitality to those visiting our city, there were very few globally recognized 5-star hotels in Taipei. The Sherwood has now become the top-choice in Taipei for renowned political and business figures from across the world.From the day the hotel was established in 1990 it has been a tradition that we welcome our guests as if they were family. The moment you step into The Sherwood, you will be warmly greeted by the smiling faces of our receptionists and you receive a personal room key that makes you feel right at home. The guestrooms are sensibly separated from the restaurants and other public areas by room guest elevators and your are ensured a tranquil, safe and comfortable stay.The Sherwood is the only Taiwanese member of the Leading Hotels of the World, and we have been featured in international travel magazines such as Travel & Leisure, Business Traveler, Asia Money and Review Asia. Our art collection, which is a tasteful fusion of Western and Chinese elements, evokes feelings similar to those gained when browsing through a gallery of the world’s masterpieces.We offer luxury treatment at The Sherwood Spa on the 20th floor and free hotel-wide Wi-Fi access in addition to access to our complimentary Executive Business Center, gym and warm indoor pool.The Sherwood is located in the Taipei financial center and shopping hub, near the unique and artistic Minsheng Community and just a ten-minute drive from Songshan Airport. The hotel is within easy access of the city via the MRT Wenhu Line or the highway system that will take you to sights all across the island. We promise to keep you in touch with the world as well as connect you to every part of the island via the extensive Taiwan transportation network.The Sherwood Taipei: Your Taste
